item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, April 13, 2025 at 6:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Experimental release of GrapheneOS for Pixel 9a (143 points | 68 comments)
2. BPS is a GPS alternative that nobody's heard of (138 points | 44 comments)
3. A Farewell to the ArcoLinux University (24 points | 2 comments)
4. Nice things with SVG (375 points | 62 comments)
5. How to not build a two stage model rocket (23 points | discuss)
6. WebTUI – A CSS Library That Brings the Beauty of Terminal UIs to the Browser (112 points | 18 comments)
7. YAML: The Norway Problem (2022) (99 points | 50 comments)
8. 33-year-old AmigaOS for Commodore computers gets an unexpected update News (28 points | 1 comment)
9. How to repair the parts that explode in Lenovo Yoga laptops (11 points | 2 comments)
10. Emacs Lisp Elements (235 points | 29 comments)
11. I ditched my laptop for a pocketable mini PC and a pair of AR glasses (82 points | 64 comments)
12. Show HN: memEx, a personal knowledge base inspired by zettlekasten and org-mode (127 points | 17 comments)
13. Open source and self hostable/private file converter (475 points | 90 comments)
14. Anubis Works (181 points | 102 comments)
15. Dust in the wind: How cities alter natural airborne particles (16 points | 1 comment)
16. Why is there a "small house" in IBM's Code page 437? (125 points | 33 comments)
17. How to Structure a B2B Marketplace Venture (25 points | discuss)
18. CERN releases report on the feasibility of a possible Future Circular Collider (85 points | 58 comments)
19. ESA has a commercial launch strategy, but will member states pay? (6 points | 2 comments)
20. Tunarr: Create and configure live TV channels from media on your servers (166 points | 44 comments)
21. ArkType: Ergonomic TS validator 100x faster than Zod (137 points | 53 comments)
22. Monty Python and the Holy Grail became a comedy legend (17 points | 3 comments)
23. Ambient music on iOS 18.4 and the return to the Apple's Music app (32 points | 15 comments)
24. Learning Assembly for Fun, Performance and Profit (52 points | 11 comments)
25. The Bitter Prediction (89 points | 55 comments)
26. Levels of configuration languages (45 points | 46 comments)
27. Air pollution fell substantially as Paris restricted car traffic (478 points | 408 comments)
28. Shadertoys Ported to Rust GPU (66 points | 21 comments)
29. Trump exempts phones, computers, chips from 'reciprocal' tariffs (250 points | 535 comments)
30. Mammoth genetic diversity throughout the last million years (22 points | 1 comment)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, April 13, 2025 at 6:20 AM UTC
